```{r}
# 1) install.packages("xtable")  # if you havenâ€™t already
library(xtable)
library(dplyr)

# 2) Build the full example data
set.seed(2025)
countries <- c(
  "USA","Germany","India","Brazil","UK",
  "Canada","Australia","France","China","Japan",
  "South Korea","Israel","Sweden","Netherlands","Switzerland",
  "Singapore","Spain","Italy","Mexico","South Africa"
)

df <- data.frame(
  Country                           = countries,
  Founded_Companies                 = sample(200:2000, 20, replace = TRUE),
  Avg_Seed_Investor_Distance_km     = round(runif(20, 50, 500), 1),
  Average_Number_of_Founders        = round(runif(20, 1, 5), 1),
  Number_of_Startup_Hubs            = sample(3:25, 20, replace = TRUE),
  Avg_Number_of_Seed_Investors      = round(runif(20, 1, 5), 2),
  Avg_Number_of_Lead_Seed_Investors = round(runif(20, 0, 3), 2),
  Proportion_Regional_Investors     = round(runif(20, 0.1, 0.6), 2),
  Proportion_Worldwide_Investors    = round(runif(20, 0.2, 0.7), 2),
  Proportion_Industry_Specific_VC   = round(runif(20, 0.15, 0.5), 2),
  Proportion_Regional_Lead_Investors= round(runif(20, 0.1, 0.6), 2),
  Proportion_Worldwide_Lead_Investors=round(runif(20, 0.2, 0.7), 2),
  Proportion_Industry_Lead_Investors = round(runif(20, 0.15, 0.5), 2),
  Proportion_Funding_Success        = round(runif(20, 0.3, 0.8), 2),
  Proportion_Exit_Success           = round(runif(20, 0.05, 0.25), 2),
  Average_Distance_to_Hub_km        = round(runif(20, 10, 100), 1),
  Average_Number_of_Seed_Rounds     = round(runif(20, 1, 4), 2),
  Average_Exits_of_Investors        = round(runif(20, 0, 2), 2),
  Avg_Seed_Investors_Portfolio_Orgs = round(runif(20, 5, 50), 1)
)

# 3) Subset & rename table1
table1 <- df %>%
  select(
    Country,
    Founded_Companies,
    Number_of_Startup_Hubs,
    Average_Number_of_Seed_Rounds,
    Avg_Seed_Investor_Distance_km,
    Avg_Number_of_Seed_Investors,
    Avg_Number_of_Lead_Seed_Investors
  ) %>%
  rename(
    Companies                     = Founded_Companies,
    `# Hubs`                      = Number_of_Startup_Hubs,
    `Avg Seed Rounds`   = Average_Number_of_Seed_Rounds,
    `Avg Seed VC Distance`  = Avg_Seed_Investor_Distance_km,
    `Avg No. Seed VC`= Avg_Number_of_Seed_Investors,
    `Avg No. Lead Seed VC` = Avg_Number_of_Lead_Seed_Investors
  )

# 4) Subset & rename table2
table2 <- df %>%
  select(
    Country,
    Proportion_Regional_Investors,
    Proportion_Worldwide_Investors,
    Proportion_Industry_Specific_VC,
    Proportion_Regional_Lead_Investors,
    Proportion_Worldwide_Lead_Investors,
    Proportion_Industry_Lead_Investors,
    Proportion_Exit_Success
  ) %>%
  rename(
    `% Regional VC`               = Proportion_Regional_Investors,
    `% Worldwide VC`              = Proportion_Worldwide_Investors,
    `% Specific VC`             = Proportion_Industry_Specific_VC,
    `% Regional Lead VC`          = Proportion_Regional_Lead_Investors,
    `% Worldwide Lead VC`         = Proportion_Worldwide_Lead_Investors,
    `% Specific Lead VC` = Proportion_Industry_Lead_Investors,
    `% Exit Success`                     = Proportion_Exit_Success
  )

# 5) Build digits vectors (length = ncol + 1)
digits1 <- c(0, rep(2, ncol(table1)))
digits2 <- c(0, rep(2, ncol(table2)))

# 6) Export as pure tabular LaTeX
print(
  xtable(
    table1,
    caption = "Table 1: Descriptive Startup Ecosystem Metrics by Country",
    label   = "tab:descriptive_metrics",
    digits  = digits1
  ),
  type                 = "latex",
  include.rownames     = FALSE,
  include.colnames     = TRUE,
  booktabs             = TRUE,
  floating             = FALSE,
  sanitize.text.function = identity,
  file                 = "table1.tex"
)

print(
  xtable(
    table2,
    caption = "Table 2: Proportional & Success Metrics by Country",
    label   = "tab:proportional_metrics",
    digits  = digits2
  ),
  type                 = "latex",
  include.rownames     = FALSE,
  include.colnames     = TRUE,
  booktabs             = TRUE,
  floating             = FALSE,
  sanitize.text.function = identity,
  file                 = "table2.tex"
)
```
